Class LSystems.Content.Koch

java.lang.Object
  LSystems.Content.Koch
Enclosing class:
LSystems.Content
public class LSystems.Content.Koch
extends java.lang.Object

This class encapsulates the details and drawing of the Koch category of plane-filling curves.

Constructor Summary

          Constructor for basic Koch curve: one key

Constructor Detail

LSystems.Content.Koch

public LSystems.Content.Koch(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String axiom,
                             java.lang.String keys,
                             java.lang.String[] productions,
                             double heading,
                             int distance,
                             double delta,
                             int factor,
                             int n,
                             double xPos,
                             double yPos)
Constructor for basic Koch curve: one key

Parameters:
name - the name of the Koch curve
axiom - the initial (generation 0) curve (the initiator in Koch parlance)
keys - the String containing the keys. Koch curve only has one key but keep as a String for future development
productions - the array of productions. Koch curve only has one production but keep as an array of String for future development
heading - the initial heading of the drawing pen (turtle) in degrees. 0 degrees is east. Positive is Counterclockwise.
distance - the length of the line to draw in pixels when moving the turtle forward (the F command)
delta - the change in the turtle's heading when executing + or - command. + is counterclockwise and - is clockwise
factor - the reduction ratio applied to distance after each generation
n - the number of generations to propagate the curve
xPos - the initial x position (column) of the turtle
yPos - the initial y position (row) of the turtle
Method Detail

generate

public java.lang.String generate(int n)
Simple recursive method that returns a String containing the set of instructions needed to draw the curve.

Parameters:
n - Number of generations to be produced.
Returns:
the String used as the definition.

myReplace

public java.lang.String myReplace(java.lang.String s)
Goes through the string, checking each position.
If the character at the position is not a key, simply add it to the new string.
If the character is a key, insert its corresponding production statement into the new string.

Parameters:
s - A string.
Returns:
The new definition.

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
This method draws the desired shape.
  1. The definition is set by calling the generate method.
  2. Using a for loop, each position of the definition is examined.

    • If the character is an F, a line is drawn from the starting x and y coordinates, to the new coordinates, defined by:

      x2 = xPos+distance*Math.cos(heading)
      y2 = yPos+distance*Math.sin(heading)

    • If the character is an f, the "pen" is lifted from the canvas and moved to the new x and y coordinates.
    • If the character is a -, the heading is modified by adding to it delta. This will turn the direction of the new line to be drawn, clockwise.
    • If the character is a +, the heading is modified by subtracting from it delta. This will turn the direction of the new line to be drawn, counter-clockwise.
    • If the character is a [, the current drawing state (position, heading, and possibly color and line thickness) of the Turtle is preserved by pushing it onto a Stack.
    • If the character is a ], the current drawing state is restored by popping it from the Stack, allowing it to 'return' to a node and continue drawing elsewhere.

Parameters:
g2 - A Graphics2D object.
